com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface TimerService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface TimerService
extends Service

The TimerService allows the agent to register a Runnable for periodic execution.

Since:
5.2.0

static interface TimerService.Task

Method Detail

scheduleAtFixedRate

TimerService.Task scheduleAtFixedRate(java.lang.Runnable command,
                                      long initialDelay,
                                      long period,
                                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
Creates and executes a periodic action that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is executions will commence after initialDelay then initialDelay+period, then initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on.

If any execution of the task encounters an exception, it is removed from the queue and will not be executed again. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation.

If any execution of this task takes longer than its period, the missed executions will be skipped, to avoid starving other scheduled tasks in the queue.

Parameters:
command - the task to execute.
initialDelay - the amount of time to delay first execution.
period - the period between successive executions.
unit - the time unit of the initialDelay and period parameters
Returns:
a Task handle which can be used to cancel this task and remove it from the timer queue. If the task cannot be scheduled for some reason, then null is returned.

scheduleOnce

TimerService.Task scheduleOnce(java.lang.Runnable command,
                               long initialDelay,
                               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
Creates and executes a task that becomes enabled first after the given inital delay and only executes once.

If the task is cancelled before it it scheduled to be executed it will not execute. Otherwise it will execute and be removed from the queue.

Parameters:
command - the task to execute
initialDelay - the time to delay first execution
unit - the time unit of the initalDelay parameter
Returns:
a Task handle that can be used to cancel this task and remove it from the timer queue. If the task cannot be scheduled for some reason, then null is returned.

scheduleWithFixedDelay

TimerService.Task scheduleWithFixedDelay(java.lang.Runnable command,
                                         long initialDelay,
                                         long delay,
                                         java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
Creates and executes a periodic action that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next.

If any execution of the task encounters an exception, it is removed from the queue and will not be executed again. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation.

Parameters:
command - the task to execute.
initialDelay - the time to delay first execution.
delay - the delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next.
unit - the time unit of the initialDelay and delay parameters
Returns:
a Task handle which can be used to cancel this task and remove it from the timer queue. If the task cannot be scheduled for some reason, then null is returned.
